Java Business Integration (JBI) Concepts

JavaBusiness Integration (JBI) seeks to create a standards-based architecture for integration solutions.

The JBI specification defines two types of components.

  • Service engines provide services to other components.

  • Binding components provide connectivity to services external to a JBI installation.

JBI components can function as service providers, service consumers, or both.

JBI components do not interact with each other directly. Instead, the JBI environment functions as an intermediary to route messages from component to component.

A service unit is a deployment artifact that is destined for a single JBI component. A service assembly is a collection of service units. During the deployment process, the service units are deployed to the appropriate service engines and binding components.
